00:00:02:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:02:030000.Dialogue: All right, Raj has played his phantom warlord card, and I am going to back him up with my strangling vines.

00:00:14:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:14:050000.Dialogue: Okay, well, then I'll just cut your vines with my ruby sword. That's right, I did it. I cut 'em.

00:00:27:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:27:220000.Dialogue: Warlord beats troll, troll beats elf, elf beats water sprite, and basically everything beats enchanted bunny.

00:00:36:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:36:120000.Dialogue: Unless you have the carrot power.

00:00:38:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:38:130000.Dialogue: Okay, I've got another question. When does this get fun?

00:00:43:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:43:170000.Dialogue: Are we going to talk or are we going to play "Mystic Warriors of Ka-ah"?

00:00:52:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:52:080000.Dialogue: It doesn't matter. You can't possibly win.

00:00:56:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:56:180000.Dialogue: How could he ruin the game?

00:00:58:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:58:040000.Dialogue: Given the cards that have already been played, Penny can only be holding necromancer potions, which are only effective against wraiths and day-walkers, and there are no more of either left to be drawn. The cards remaining in the undrawn stack are: four fire weapons, a troll, two ogres and the jewel of Osiris.

00:01:17:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:17:130000.Dialogue: From your vantage point, it certainly must seem so.

00:01:20:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:20:180000.Dialogue: Sheldon has kind of a photographic memory.

00:01:23:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:23:230000.Dialogue: "Photographic" is a misnomer. I have an eidetic memory, as I've told you many times. Most recently last year during lunch on the afternoon of may seventh.

00:01:34:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:34:020000.Dialogue: You had turkey and complained it was dry.

00:01:46:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:46:190000.Dialogue: Because the last me I didn't go, I ended up playing "mystic warlords of ka."

00:01:56:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:56:040000.Dialogue: See ya. Still can't believe she's going out with me.

00:02:05:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:05:020000.Dialogue: That reminds me, I have a bone to pick with you.

00:02:08:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:08:090000.Dialogue: You and I made a pact that if either of us ever got a hot girlfriend, That person would have his girlfriend hook the other guy up with one of her girlfriends.

00:02:21:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:21:220000.Dialogue: Opening day of spider-man 2 at the AMC Pasadena. They only had red icees, no blue.

00:02:30:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:30:150000.Dialogue: So you've been with Penny for like a month and a half now. Where's my shorty, Morty?

00:02:34:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:34:190000.Dialogue: Howard, you can't hold me to that.

00:02:39:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:39:130000.Dialogue: Because when I made that agreement, I didn't think I'd ever have a hot girlfriend. And I was positive you never would.

00:02:45:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:45:070000.Dialogue: Hey, how come I wasn't part of this deal?

00:02:48:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:48:010000.Dialogue: You had left the refreshment stand in order to indulge in your customary preemptive pre-show urination.

00:02:53:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:53:070000.Dialogue: Oh, so that's how it works? I have a teeny bladder and now I don't get a hot girlfriend?

00:02:58:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:58:160000.Dialogue: Yeah, Raj. That's how it works.

00:03:31:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:31:010000.Dialogue: Oh, damn it. Can I have a napkin?

00:03:37:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:37:020000.Dialogue: But you have a whole bunch of 'em.

00:03:39:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:39:140000.Dialogue: Yes, I've moved to a four-napkin system. Lap, hands, face and personal emergencies.

00:03:47:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:47:200000.Dialogue: If you like, starting tomorrow, I'll add a guest napkin, but I'm afraid there's nothing I can do for you today.

00:03:57:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:57:170000.Dialogue: Good luck. That's the face napkin.

00:04:01:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:01:220000.Dialogue: So, have you talked to Penny yet?

00:04:06:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:06:030000.Dialogue: Because I've been busy, because I haven't figured out a way to bring it up, and mostly... and I can't stress how key this is... because I don't want to.

00:04:14:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:14:150000.Dialogue: Leonard, a pact is a pact. You have to get Penny to fix me up.

00:04:18:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:18:060000.Dialogue: It's not that simple. What am I supposed to say? "Penny, do you have any friends you'd like to never hear from again?"

00:04:23:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:23:010000.Dialogue: Come on, I'm smart, I have good job and I have only three percent body fat.

00:04:29:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:29:180000.Dialogue: It's true. I've seen him at the beach. He's like a human chicken wing.

00:04:36:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:36:090000.Dialogue: Fine. I'll ask if she has a friend for you.

00:04:40:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:40:210000.Dialogue: And tall. I want our kids to be able to ride space mountain before they're 20.

00:04:45:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:45:100000.Dialogue: Ii'll see what I can do.

00:04:47:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:47:200000.Dialogue: Hey, Sheldon, guess what I heard today?

00:04:49:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:49:220000.Dialogue: I'd imagine you heard any number of things today. When you arrived at work you undoubtedly heard, "hello, Raj." "How are you, Raj?" Given that you're wearing a new sweater-vest, you may have heard "new sweater6vest?". And possibly, though far less likely, "nice sweater-vest."

00:05:02:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:02:140000.Dialogue: Why don't I just tell you what i heard today.

00:05:06:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:06:030000.Dialogue: That would probably save us some time.

00:05:08:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:08:220000.Dialogue: Saturday night at the comic book store, they're having a "mystic warlords of ka-ah" tournament. First prize is $500. If we team up, we'd be unstoppable.

00:05:17:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:17:080000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, Raj, but I have no interest in playing a game in which I find no challenge.

00:05:25:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:25:170000.Dialogue: How does it different from the money I have?

00:05:28:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:28:040000.Dialogue: Half of it will be mine.

00:05:30:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:30:090000.Dialogue: Do you need it to buy a less disturbing sweater-vest?

00:05:37:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:37:060000.Dialogue: Are you kidding? I couldn't even talk him into giving one of his freakin' napkins.

00:05:45:110000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:05:45:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:45:110000.Dialogue: Wow, you really are a genius.

00:05:50:050000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:05:50:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:50:050000.Dialogue: Not really. I googled how to do that.

00:05:58:190000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:05:58:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:58:190000.Dialogue: So, listen... have you ever made a pact with someone?

00:06:06:230000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:06:06:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:06:230000.Dialogue: OkAy, fine, like a pinky swear. Well, in the first grade, my friend Rosie and I made a pact to marry Bert and Ernie. You know, from Sesame Street?

00:06:16:160000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:06:16:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:16:160000.Dialogue: I'm familiar with Bert and Ernie.

00:06:19:150000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:06:19:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:19:150000.Dialogue: Knowing fact, we both wanted Ernie. We didn't speak again until middle school.

00:06:24:030000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:06:24:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:25:220000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:06:25:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:25:220000.Dialogue: The heart wants what the heart wants, Leonard.

00:06:29:060000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:06:29:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:29:060000.Dialogue: Okay. Speaking of what the heart wants... Um, a long time ago, I made a pact with Wolowitz that kind of involves you.

00:06:47:190000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:06:47:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:47:190000.Dialogue: Okay, I don't know where you're going with this,

00:06:52:010000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:06:52:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:52:010000.Dialogue: but tread carefully because it may be the last conversation we ever have.

00:06:57:010000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:06:57:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:57:010000.Dialogue: No, no, nothing like that. The deal was that if either of us ever got a girlfriend, we'd have her fix the other one up with one of her friends.

00:07:07:080000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:07:07:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:07:080000.Dialogue: And you thought a good time to bring this up be right after sex.

00:07:09:090000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:07:09:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:09:090000.Dialogue: Well, I sure as hell wasn't gonna bring it up before sex.

00:07:16:030000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:07:16:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:16:030000.Dialogue: And during, I was trying to remember what I read on google, so...

00:07:22:200000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:07:22:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:22:200000.Dialogue: I'm not hooking Wolowitz up with one of my friends.

00:07:25:150000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:07:25:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:25:150000.Dialogue: It doesn't have to be a good friend. And you know that deep down inside, Howard's a really nice guy.

00:07:32:210000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:07:32:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:32:210000.Dialogue: The problem isn't what's on the inside. It's the creepy candy coating.

00:07:37:220000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:07:37:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:37:220000.Dialogue: Will you at least think about it? Just as a favor to me?

00:07:43:200000.Scene: Leonard and Penny are in bed.
00:07:43:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:43:200000.Dialogue: Oh, great thing about Ernie, was he never asked me for anything. He just gave.

00:07:55:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:55:040000.Dialogue: Got it. Got it. Got it. Got it. Got it. Got it. Betty and Veronica? Oh.

00:08:05:090000.Speaker: Stuart
00:08:05:090000.Dialogue: Hey, Sheldon, the new Green Lantern figurine's coming in tomorrow. Want me to set one aside for you?

00:08:09:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:09:100000.Dialogue: Thank you. You just robbed me of the opportunity to stumb upon the figurine and make the oh-so-satisfying journey from discovery to desire to possession.

00:08:17:230000.Speaker: Stuart
00:08:17:230000.Dialogue: All right, I won't set one aside for you.

00:08:21:110000.Speaker: Stuart
00:08:21:110000.Dialogue: Okay, I'll set one aside for you. Thank you.

00:08:23:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:23:230000.Dialogue: You know, I can buy all these things online. I come here for the personal service.

00:08:31:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:31:150000.Dialogue: Hey, Stuart, is the Wil Wheaton signed up For the mystic warlords tournament. The Wil Wheaton from Star Trek?

00:08:36:230000.Speaker: Stuart
00:08:36:230000.Dialogue: Yeah, he lives around here. Big gamer.

00:08:40:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:40:150000.Dialogue: Are you saying that Wil Wheaton aka Ensign Wesley Crusher on Star Trek: The next generation is going to be participating in your tournament?

00:08:48:070000.Speaker: Stuart
00:08:48:070000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry, did I rob you of the opportunity to stumble onto that for yourself?

00:08:53:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:53:210000.Dialogue: Growing up, I idolized Wil Wheaton? Wesley Crusher had an eidetic memory just like me.

00:09:01:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:01:100000.Dialogue: Ooh, what a coincidence. Meanwhile you're playing in the tournament. Sign here.

00:09:05:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:05:080000.Dialogue: I was such a fan that in 1995, I traveled ten hours by bus to a sci-fi convention in Jackson, Mississippi, wearing my star flee academy cadet uniform in order to meet Wil Wheaton and get him to autograph my mint in-package Wesley Crusher action figure..

00:09:21:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:21:010000.Dialogue: Ooh, it'll be like a reunion then. Sign here.

00:09:24:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:24:230000.Dialogue: My arduous journey, however, was for naught. Although advertised to appear, he did not show up. It was at that moment, I vowed eternal hatred for Wil Wheaton.

00:09:34:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:34:050000.Dialogue: Okay, great, you can tell him you hate him. Sign here.

00:09:37:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:37:230000.Dialogue: It might also interest you to know that Wil Wheaton currently ranks sixth on my a-time enemies list... right between director Joel Schumacher, Who nearly destroyed the Batman movie franchise, and Billy Sparks, who lived down the street from me and put dog poop on the handles of my bicycle.

00:09:53:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:53:130000.Dialogue: Okay, I get it. He's a bad guy. Sign here.

00:09:56:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:56:200000.Dialogue: In the words of khan noonn singh in the immortal wrath ofhan, "he tasks me. He tasks me and I shall have him."

00:10:07:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:07:090000.Dialogue: From hell's heart, I stab at thee."

00:10:12:170000.Speaker: Stuart
00:10:12:170000.Dialogue: All right, Raj, looks like you're teamed up with "die, Wil Wheaton, die."

00:10:23:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:23:160000.Dialogue: So, tell me more about the future mother of my children.

00:10:27:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:27:120000.Dialogue: She's adorable, Howard. I think you'll like her.

00:10:30:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:30:110000.Dialogue: Great. So what did you tell her about me? Did you mention the body fat?

00:10:35:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:35:000000.Dialogue: No, I thought that would be a nice surprise for her.

00:10:43:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:43:100000.Dialogue: I just told her you're an aerospace engineer, you speak five languages...

00:10:49:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:49:080000.Dialogue: Girls don't count Klingon, Howard. Right?

00:10:55:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:55:160000.Dialogue: Oh. And I told her you have an unhealthy attachment to your mother.

00:11:16:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:16:000000.Dialogue: My enchanted troll bludgeons your screaming harpy with a cursed mace. Game.

00:11:21:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:21:230000.Dialogue: Sorry, boys. Say hi to your mother when she picks you up. Or I could just tell her later tonight!

00:11:30:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:30:110000.Dialogue: We pawned them, dude! Up top!

00:11:32:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:32:130000.Dialogue: Look at him. Wil Wheaton, my old friend. I have chased you 'round the moons of Nibia and 'round the Antares maelstrom and 'round perdition's flames!

00:11:45:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:45:100000.Dialogue: You know, you keep quoting Wrath of Khan, but he was in next generation. It's a totally different set of characters.

00:11:53:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:53:120000.Dialogue: How much longer must I wait for my revenge?

00:11:56:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:56:120000.Dialogue: Well, if Wil Wheaton and Stuart win their match and we beat lonely Larry and captain sweatpants in the next round, we'll face off for the championship.

00:12:04:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:04:070000.Dialogue: So, my path to satisfaction is blocked by lonely Larry and captain sweatpants.

00:12:11:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:11:010000.Dialogue: Very well. They must be destroyed.

00:12:15:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:15:230000.Dialogue: Dude, you have to stop talking like that. It's really lame.

00:12:25:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:25:210000.Dialogue: So, Penny tells me you're working as a waitress to put yourself through grad school. That's pretty great. What are you studying?

00:12:34:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:34:070000.Dialogue: Oh, cool. So you could study me.

00:12:41:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:41:050000.Dialogue: Microbiology is the study of tiny living things.

00:12:48:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:48:230000.Dialogue: And I said you could study me 'cause I'm a tiny living thing. It's a joke.

00:13:08:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:08:150000.Dialogue: Like in the bedroom or like Dungeons and Dragons?

00:13:20:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:20:150000.Dialogue: I had to ask. You didn't have to say yes.

00:13:36:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:36:130000.Dialogue: I play my endless serpent. Raj will play ecstatic frenzy, which means Larry will have to play chaos overlord. Then captain sweatpants, molten river. I play nightshade dryad. Game, set and match.

00:13:57:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:57:040000.Dialogue: Bot-tash bir jab-loo-di rekh kkhakkh-o ny!

00:14:02:070000.Speaker: Wil Wheaton
00:14:02:070000.Dialogue: Did that guy just say "revenge is a dish best served cold" in Klingon?

00:14:20:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:20:150000.Dialogue: How about computers? Do you like computers?

00:14:24:050000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:24:050000.Dialogue: I use them. I don't like them.

00:14:27:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:27:010000.Dialogue: Okay... Puppies? Where do you stand on puppies?

00:14:33:000000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:33:000000.Dialogue: A puppy once bit my face.

00:14:37:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:37:220000.Dialogue: How about that? Einstein was wrong.

00:14:41:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:41:060000.Dialogue: Approaching the speed of light doesn't slow down time. Approaching them does.

00:14:48:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:48:050000.Dialogue: Excuse me. Oh, damn. It's my mother.

00:14:51:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:51:200000.Dialogue: Are you going to answer it?

00:14:53:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:53:030000.Dialogue: I'm torn. She might be dying, and, you know, I wouldn't want to miss that. On the other hand, if I let it go to voicemail, I could play it over and over.

00:15:05:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:05:040000.Dialogue: I know how you feel. My mother makes me crazy.

00:15:09:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:09:130000.Dialogue: Not as crazy as my mother makes me.

00:15:12:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:12:060000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah? Does your mother call you every day at work to see if you've had a healthy lunch?

00:15:16:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:16:170000.Dialogue: My mother calls me at workk to see if I had a healthy bowel movement.

00:15:25:030000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:25:030000.Dialogue: Okay, well, does she lay out your clothes for you in the morning like you're nine years old?

00:15:35:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:35:100000.Dialogue: Ooh, rough. Okay, check this out. My mother made me wear rubber gloves to kindergarten so I wouldn't pick up a disease from the other children.

00:15:43:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:43:210000.Dialogue: That's nothing. I couldn't ride a bicycle 'cause my mother was afraid I'd hit a bump and lose my virginity.

00:15:49:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:49:210000.Dialogue: Oh, wow. You didn't, did you?

00:15:53:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:53:060000.Dialogue: Not on a bicyclle. In a camry. Oh!

00:16:04:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:04:030000.Dialogue: Listen, you have to come to shabbat dinner at my house sometime.

00:16:08:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:08:230000.Dialogue: A catholic girl like you wearing a big cross like that might just give my mother the big brain aneurysm I've been hoping for.

00:16:17:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:17:230000.Dialogue: Okay, but only if you come to Sunday dinner at my house wearing a yarmulke.

00:16:25:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:25:200000.Dialogue: Am I a matchmaker or what?

00:16:41:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:41:110000.Dialogue: Underworld guardian. We skirmish to the death.

00:17:10:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:10:000000.Dialogue: You're holding two moderate spell cards, a small rock and a potion of Zancor, which will be about as much help as an air conditioner on the ice planet Hoth. Your only move is to play the potion, lose the skirmish, a nd two moves later, the game.

00:17:31:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:31:170000.Dialogue: The place: Jackson, Mississippi. Having spent ten hours on a bus, during which I had to twice violate my personal rule against relieving myself on board a moving vehicle...

00:17:45:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:45:010000.Dialogue: I finally arrived at the fourth annual Dixie-Trek convention only to find that my idol Wil Wheaton decided he had better things to do than to show up and sign my action figure.

00:18:10:200000.Speaker: Wil Wheaton
00:18:10:200000.Dialogue: You went to the '95 Dixie-Trek? Oh, dude, my grandmother had just died, and I had to go to her funeral.

00:18:30:180000.Speaker: Wil Wheaton
00:18:30:180000.Dialogue: Yeah, it was. But I'm really sorry that I disappointed you.

00:18:36:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:36:060000.Dialogue: No, no, I understand. Anything happened to my mee-maw, I'd be one inconsolable moon pie.

00:18:44:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:44:080000.Dialogue: I should clarify that statement by explaining that she calls me "moon pie."

00:18:49:060000.Speaker: Wil Wheaton
00:18:49:060000.Dialogue: It'a special relationship, isn't it, between a boy and his grandmother?

00:18:55:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:55:060000.Dialogue: Okay, great, everybody loves their grandmas! Now, come on, Sheldon, finish him off!

00:19:00:230000.Speaker: Wil Wheaton
00:19:00:230000.Dialogue: It's okay, Sheldon. I let you down. I deserve it. Potion of Zancor.

00:19:12:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:12:180000.Dialogue: Kill Wil Wheaton! From hell's heart, stab at him!

00:19:21:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:21:040000.Dialogue: Sure you can. Do it! Do it!

00:19:24:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:24:030000.Dialogue: No. I came here to defeat Wil Wheaton, the man who destroyed my dreams. But I can't defeat Wil Wheaton, the man who loved is mee-maw.

00:19:46:030000.Speaker: Wil Wheaton
00:19:46:030000.Dialogue: I call my mee-maw "nana." And she's going  be very happy to hear that my small rock kills your enchanted bunny.

00:20:04:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:04:020000.Dialogue: I... I... I don't understand. Your grandmother's alive?

00:20:08:010000.Speaker: Wil Wheaton
00:20:08:010000.Dialogue: Oh, you catch on quick. Come on, Stewie, let's get our prize money.
